meanings.definition: A member of the Craniata, a subphylum of chordates that includes all vertebrates except for the hagfishes and lampreys.
meanings.sent1: The craniates have well-defined skulls to protect their brains.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study craniates to learn more about vertebrate evolution.
meanings.sent3: The craniates had a party in their underwater castle.
meanings.sent4: In the forest of craniates, the trees were made of bones and the rivers flowed with knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The craniates swam gracefully through the crystal-clear waters, their intelligence shining through.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of craniates.
meanings.sent1: The craniates features were evident in the fossil record.
meanings.sent2: Her research focused on the craniates traits found in various species.
meanings.sent3: The craniates-themed party decorations were a hit with the guests.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a craniates labyrinth, full of twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The craniates influence could be seen in the design of the new exhibit.
